question: Have you read the consent information and agree to participate in the study?

Do you currently work in the production agriculture industry? Production agriculture is defined as 'Agricultural production is a series of activities that result in a product that will ultimately be sold at retail' (Minnesota Department of Revenue).
How many years have you worked in the production agriculture industry?

In your opinion, as someone who works in production agriculture, how often do you experience 'job stress'?

Job stress can be defined as the harmful physical and emotional responses that occur when the requirements of the job do not match the capabilities, resources, or needs of the worker. (US CDC)

On average, what is your level of 'job stress' as someone who works in production agriculture?

Job stress can be defined as the harmful physical and emotional responses that occur when the requirements of the job do not match the capabilities, resources, or needs of the worker. (US CDC)
I feel pressure to continue or take over the family farming operation.
I feel pressure to keep up with advancements in farming technology or methods.
My job responsibilities limit my ability to attend social or community events.
I worry about the stability of my farming operation or job.
The yearly loss of animals or crops significantly impacts my emotional well-being.
Market fluctuations contribute significantly to my stress levels.
Rising input costs (e.g., feed, equipment, labor) increase my stress levels.
Extreme weather conditions (e.g., droughts, floods) significantly impact my stress levels.
The physical demands of my job negatively affect my overall health.
I find it stressful to hire, train, or retain skilled labor for my farming operation.
Agricultural policies or government regulations create additional stress for me.
My farming responsibilities prevent me from balancing work and personal time effectively.
I feel confident in my ability to manage unexpected challenges in farming.
As someone who works in production agriculture, what other conditions contribute to your job stress?
If you have a high-ranked stressor, why have you ranked the stressor(s) highly?
Any additional comments related to stress as someone who works in production agriculture?
